weka.classifiers.timeseries.core

Interface ConfidenceIntervalForecaster

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WekaForecaster

    public interface ConfidenceIntervalForecaster
    Interface to a forecaster that can compute confidence intervals for its forecasts
    Version:
    $Revision: 45163 $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Return the number of steps for which confidence intervals will be computed.
      double getConfidenceLevel()
      Get the confidence level in use for computing confidence intervals.

      Set the number of steps for which to compute confidence intervals for.

    • Method Detail

      • setConfidenceLevel

        void setConfidenceLevel(double confLevel)
        Set the confidence level for confidence intervals.
        Parameters:
        confLevel - the confidence level to use.

      • getConfidenceLevel

        double getConfidenceLevel()
        Get the confidence level in use for computing confidence intervals.
        Returns:
        the confidence level.

      • isProducingConfidenceIntervals

        boolean isProducingConfidenceIntervals()
        Returns true if this forecaster is computing confidence limits for some or all of its future forecasts (i.e. getCalculateConfIntervalsForForecasts() > 0).
        Returns:
        true if confidence limits will be produced for some or all of its future forecasts.

      • setCalculateConfIntervalsForForecasts

        void setCalculateConfIntervalsForForecasts(int steps)
        Set the number of steps for which to compute confidence intervals for. E.g. a value of 5 means that confidence bounds will be computed for 1-step-ahead predictions, 2-step-ahead predictions, ..., 5-step-ahead predictions. Setting a value of 0 indicates that no confidence intervals will be computed/produced.
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps for which to compute confidence intervals for.

      • getCalculateConfIntervalsForForecasts

        int getCalculateConfIntervalsForForecasts()
        Return the number of steps for which confidence intervals will be computed. A value of 0 indicates that no confidence intervals will be computed/produced.
        Returns:
        the number of steps for which confidence intervals will be computed.
